detail_description: Piazza Vecchia is a stunning square located in the center of the old town, surrounded by noble houses and the Palazzo della Ragione. The Palazzo della Ragione, dating back to the 12th century, features a striking stone staircase and a loggia with three Gothic arches. Adjacent to this architectural marvel stands the Torre del Comune, adding to the historical charm of this picturesque piazza.
name: Piazza Vecchia

excerpt: Established museum with works from the 15th–19th centuries by celebrated artists, plus a gift shop.
detail_description: The Accademia Carrara Museum is a renowned art destination in Bergamo, Italy, showcasing an impressive collection of works from the 15th to 19th centuries. The museum features masterpieces by celebrated artists such as Pisanello, Botticelli, Bellini, Moroni, Raffaello, Tiepolo and Canaletto. Visitors can explore nearly 2,000 authentic paintings, sculptures and decorative works within the stunning neoclassical building.
name: Accademia Carrara Museum
address: Piazza Giacomo Carrara, 82, 24121 Bergamo BG, Italy

excerpt: Surrounded by the 16th-century Venetian Walls, the medieval Città Alta is dominated by the Rocca di Bergamo fortress. Handsome piazzas house the arcaded Palazzo della Ragione, the Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore with its gilded interior, and the intricate marble facade of the Cappella Colleoni. Narrow alleys are lined with upscale indie boutiques and delis, as well as centuries-old cafes, trattorias, and wine bars.
detail_description: Città Alta, located within the 16th-century Venetian Walls, is a medieval gem dominated by the Rocca di Bergamo fortress. The area boasts charming piazzas hosting historic landmarks like the Palazzo della Ragione and Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore. Visitors can explore narrow alleys lined with upscale boutiques, delis, and centuries-old cafes.
name: Città Alta

excerpt: Colored marble exterior & frescoed ceiling in a 15th-century funerary chapel with columns & statues.
detail_description: The Colleoni Chapel, located in Bergamo, is a stunning 15th-century funerary chapel known for its colored marble exterior and frescoed ceiling. This Italian Renaissance masterpiece is dedicated to Saints Bartholomew, Mark, and John the Baptist and features an overwhelming mass of decoration that dazzles the eye.
name: Colleoni Chapel

excerpt: Bergamo is an Italian city northeast of Milan, in the Lombardy region. Its older upper district, called Città Alta, is characterized by cobblestone streets, encircled by Venetian walls and accessible by funicular. It's home to the Duomo di Bergamo, the city cathedral. Also here are the Romanesque Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore and the grand Cappella Colleoni, a chapel with 18th-century frescoes by Tiepolo.
detail_description: Bergamo, an Italian city in the Lombardy region, is known for its charming Città Alta, featuring cobblestone streets and Venetian walls. The area houses notable landmarks such as the Duomo di Bergamo, Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore, and Cappella Colleoni. The culinary scene in Bergamo has also been making waves with restaurants like Impronte gaining a Michelin star.
name: Bergamo

excerpt: Romanesque church with an ornate marble porch & a lavishly gilded interior hung with tapestries.
detail_description: The Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore is a stunning Romanesque church featuring an elaborate marble porch and a lavishly gilded interior adorned with tapestries. Originally under the administration of the Chapter of San Vincenzo, it was later entrusted to the Congregazione della Misericordia Maggiore. This historic site served as a Collegiate Church until the 1970s and housed its own clergy and seminary.
name: Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore

excerpt: This historic cathedral with a neoclassical facade & notable artwork is the seat of a bishop.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Città Alta, Bergamo Cathedral is a stunning testament to history and architecture that dates back to the 12th century. This remarkable structure showcases an impressive neoclassical facade adorned with intricate sculptures, while its grand nave and soaring dome dominate the skyline of Old Town. As you step inside, you'll be greeted by a treasure trove of artistic masterpieces, including works by renowned artists like Giovan Battista Moroni and Andrea Previtali.
name: Bergamo Cathedral

excerpt: This tower was built in the 12th century as a home for the Suardi family & offers panoramic views.
detail_description: Campanone, also known as the Civic Tower, is a medieval tower located in Bergamo's Upper Town. Standing at over 52 meters high, it was built in the 12th century and offers panoramic views of the old town and its mountainous surroundings. Visitors can access the observation deck via a staircase with around 230 steps or take an elevator for convenience.
name: Campanone

detail_description: In the heart of Bergamo Alta, Piazza Vecchia is a bustling square surrounded by historical landmarks. One of the prominent buildings here is Palazzo della Ragione, which boasts a facade adorned with the lion of St. Mark. Adjacent to this municipal building is the imposing Palazzo Nuovo housing the Angelo Mai Civic Library.
name: Palazzo della Ragione (Palazzo Vecchio)

excerpt: Imposing 14th-c. stronghold with a tower offering panoramic views & a museum of Bergamo's history.
detail_description: Rocca di Bergamo is a striking 14th-century fortress situated on the hill of Sant'Eufemia in Bergamo's upper town. It offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city and the Alps. The fortress houses a section of the city's history museum, providing an intriguing look into Bergamo's rich past. Visitors can explore remnants from the city's military history while strolling through the grounds.
name: Rocca di Bergamo
address: Piazzale Brigata Legnano, 16, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: Piazza Vecchia in Bergamo Alta is a charming public square steeped in history and surrounded by iconic landmarks. The Contarini fountain, Palazzo della Ragione, and the imposing Campanone Clock Tower are just a few of the architectural marvels that adorn this picturesque space. Visitors can also admire the Cathedral, Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore with its intricate carvings by Lorenzo Lotto, and the Baptistery featuring Colleoni's coat of arms.
name: Piazza Vecchia Bergamo Alta

detail_description: Ufficio Turistico - Bergamo Città Bassa is located in the lower town of Bergamo, Italy. The city is divided into two parts: the historic Citta Alta (Upper Town) and Citta Bassa (Lower Town), surrounded by picturesque natural beauty including green hills and the snow-capped Orobic Alps.
name: Ufficio Turistico - Bergamo Città Bassa
address: Piazzale Guglielmo Marconi, 24122 Bergamo BG, Italy

excerpt: Remains of an ancient stone castle on a hill with hidden underground tunnels & views over the town.
detail_description: Torre Castello San Vigilio is an ancient stone castle located on a hill in Bergamo, offering stunning panoramic views of the town and surrounding mountain ranges. Accessible by a funicular railway, this spot provides a peaceful retreat with plenty of seating areas to enjoy the contrasting scenery. The castle ruins and hidden underground tunnels add to the allure of this historical site. While currently closed due to the pandemic, visitors can still explore the beautiful garden and capture breathtaking photos of the landscape.
name: Torre Castello San Vigilio
address: Via al Castello, 14, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

excerpt: Landmark white marble gate & stone viaduct overlooking the plain, preserved from a ruined city wall.
detail_description: Porta San Giacomo is a stunning white marble gate and stone viaduct that stands as an iconic symbol of Bergamo's old town. This 16th-century structure, part of the Venetian fortifications, is a UNESCO World Heritage site and a must-see attraction. The gate's impressive white and pink marble from Zandobbio glows beautifully in the sunlight, creating a magical backdrop for the city.
name: Porta San Giacomo

detail_description: Piazza del Duomo is the bustling centerpiece of the city, boasting an impressive array of architectural marvels including the Cathedral, Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore, Colleoni Chapel, and the Baptistery. This monumental square is a must-visit for those seeking to immerse themselves in the rich history and stunning beauty of the city's religious and cultural heritage.
name: Piazza del Duomo

excerpt: Family-friendly museum of natural history with a collection of regional animal specimens & fossils.
detail_description: The Civic Museum of Natural Sciences in Bergamo, established in 1861, is a great destination for those fascinated by zoology, entomology, geology, and paleontology. Situated near the Archaeological Museum in Piazza della Cittadella, it features an array of intriguing exhibits including a mammoth skeleton, arthropod collection, whale skeleton and precious stones. The museum offers interactive experiences for children to touch stuffed animals and various fossils.
name: Civic Museum of Natural Sciences in Bergamo
address: P.za della Cittadella, 10, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: La Marianna is a renowned bar and pastry shop known for its delicious fiordilatte gelato enriched with large pieces of dark chocolate. The idea for this delectable treat originated from the recipe for stracciatella alla romana and has been a specialty at La Marianna since 1961. The cafe, currently managed by Niccolo Panattoni, offers seating in a charming shaded courtyard, making it an ideal spot for breakfast or a snack before or after an afternoon concert.
name: La Marianna
address: L.go Colle Aperto, 4, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: In Bergamo's lower city, known as citta bassa, visitors can indulge in a modern shopping experience without leaving the area. Via XX Settembre, the bustling heart of this district, is lined with vibrant cafes and an array of boutiques and shops. Named to commemorate a significant milestone in Italy's history, this charming street offers a lively atmosphere for leisurely strolls and retail therapy.
name: Via XX Settembre

excerpt: This Catholic church originated in the 8th century & features frescoes on its ceiling & walls.
detail_description: Nestled on the outskirts of Bergamo Alta, Chiesa Di San Michele Al Pozzo Bianco is a hidden gem that dates back to the 8th century. Although the original structure has long since vanished, stepping inside reveals a stunning array of frescoes that showcase various artistic styles, including captivating Byzantine influences from the 15th century. The vibrant colors and intricate details are particularly prominent around the altar but can also be found adorning other walls throughout this charming church.
name: Chiesa Di San Michele Al Pozzo Bianco
address: Via Porta Dipinta, 45, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

excerpt: Established in 1972, this modest botanical garden features over 900 species of plants.
detail_description: Nestled above the upper part of Bergamo, the Bergamo Botanical Garden "Lorenzo Rota" is a charming and modest botanical garden established in 1972. With over 900 plant species, it offers a peaceful escape from the bustling city below. Despite its small size, it provides a delightful opportunity for a leisurely stroll surrounded by nature and offers stunning views of the surroundings. The well-designed pathways allow visitors to closely admire the diverse plants on display.
name: Bergamo Botanical Garden "Lorenzo Rota"
address: Scaletta Colle Aperto, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: Sentierone is home to the Bergamo Earth Market, which takes place every Saturday from 8:30 am to 1 pm. The market offers a variety of healthy and delicious products, including bread, cheeses, beer, flour, fruits, vegetables, and sparkling wine for festive occasions like Christmas. Additionally, traditional items such as salami and cotechino are available for celebrating Christmas and New Year's Eve in an authentic manner.
name: Sentierone

excerpt: Restored building from 1800 with a grand auditorium hosting opera, jazz & drama.
detail_description: The Gaetano Donizetti Theater, also known as Teatro Donizetti, is a beautifully restored 18th-century building in Bergamo. Named after the renowned composer Domenico Gaetano Maria Donizetti, the theater hosts a variety of performances including opera, jazz, and drama. The venue's grand auditorium provides a stunning setting for cultural events throughout the year.
name: Gaetano Donizetti Theater
address: P.za Camillo Benso Conte di Cavour, 15, 24121 Bergamo BG, Italy

excerpt: Pair of colonnaded, neoclassical buildings dating from the 1830s, with views of the hilltop city.
detail_description: Porta Nuova, also known as Barriera delle Grazie, is a grand gate in Bergamo that replaced an old wicket gate in 1837. It offers stunning views of the hilltop city and is surrounded by neoclassical buildings from the 1830s. The area around Porta Nuova is lively and vibrant, especially during Christmas time when it features pedestrian areas, a shopping district, coffee shops, and Christmas markets.
name: Porta Nuova
address: Largo Porta Nuova, 24121 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo Nuovo, located in Bergamo Alta, Italy, stands out with its bright white marbles and houses the Angelo Mai Civic Library. This important library holds over 600,000 volumes, more than 2,000 incunabula, and over 16,000 manuscripts. The palace itself has a rich history as it was the seat of the Municipality of Bergamo for three centuries until 1873.
name: Palazzo Nuovo

excerpt: Built for defense, these iconic 16-century walls are a popular walking spot with sweeping views.
detail_description: Mura Veneziane-Patrimonio UNESCO, the stunning 16th-century defensive walls, offer visitors a remarkable walking experience with breathtaking panoramic views. These historic structures not only showcase Italy's rich cultural heritage but also play a vital role in promoting tourism in cities recognized as UNESCO Creative Cities. The initiative aims to enhance the appeal and competitiveness of these locations by supporting projects that highlight their unique cultural assets.
name: Mura Veneziane
address: Viale delle Mura, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

excerpt: Memorial tower in honor of WWI soldiers overlooking the city center, with frescoes & a viewing deck.
detail_description: The Torre dei Caduti stands as a poignant memorial to the soldiers of World War I, proudly overlooking the vibrant city center of Bergamo. This historic tower not only serves as a tribute but also offers visitors an opportunity to delve into its rich past through informative displays on each level. The first floor is particularly moving, dedicated to honoring the fallen heroes.
name: Torre dei caduti
address: P.za Vittorio Veneto, 24122 Bergamo BG, Italy

excerpt: Gallery in a 15th-century convent, showing 20th-century Italian pieces & work by emerging artists.
detail_description: GAMeC, the Modern and Contemporary Art Gallery of Bergamo, is housed in a 15th-century convent opposite the Carrara Academy. It was established in 1991 and occupies 1,500 square meters across ten rooms on three floors. The gallery features four main collections: the Pio Manzu Collection of Industrial Design Works, the Spajani Collection, the Stucchi Collection, and the Kaleidoscope Room.
name: GAMeC - Modern and Contemporary Art Gallery of Bergamo
address: Via San Tomaso, 53, 24121 Bergamo BG, Italy

excerpt: Tours in an opulent 17th-century palace featuring Baroque architecture, an art collection & gardens.
detail_description: Palazzo e Giardini Moroni is an extravagant 17th-century palace located in Bergamo Alta. The interior boasts stunning Baroque architecture and a rich art collection, with opulent frescoes adorning the walls and ceilings. Visitors can take a self-guided tour through several rooms inside the palazzo and explore the beautifully landscaped gardens at the back. The rose-filled gardens feature neatly clipped topiary and offer picturesque views of the surrounding mountains, providing a serene setting for relaxation.
name: Palazzo e Giardini Moroni
address: Via Porta Dipinta, 12, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: Piazza Mercato delle Scarpe is a charming square that serves as the starting point for an enchanting tour. From here, you can embark on a journey to Rocca Castle, offering breathtaking views of the Lower Town. As you continue your walk, you'll encounter Piazza Vecchia and Piazza Duomo, where notable landmarks like the Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore and the Colleoni Chapel await.
name: Piazza Mercato delle Scarpe

detail_description: Parco Del Castello Di San Vigilio is a picturesque destination located in Bergamo, Italy. Visitors can take the San Vigilio funicular from Largo di Porta San Alessandro to reach the top of San Vigilio hill, where they can enjoy stunning views across Lombardy and explore a network of hiking trails in Parco dei Colli. The area is surrounded by terraced fields and thick chestnut forests, providing a peaceful escape from the city.
name: Parco Del Castello Di San Vigilio
address: Via al Castello, ., 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

excerpt: Streamlined accommodations in an understated guesthouse featuring a communal kitchen.
detail_description: Bergamo Bassa is a vibrant area that beautifully contrasts with the medieval charm of its upper counterpart. This bustling district offers streamlined accommodations, including cozy guesthouses equipped with communal kitchens, perfect for travelers looking to connect and share experiences. While budget airlines may tempt you with low fares, be cautious of hidden costs like late-night hotel stays near the airport—something Gemma and Craig learned firsthand during their European adventure. In Bergamo Bassa, you'll find modern amenities alongside rich history.
name: Bergamo Bassa

detail_description: L.go Colle Aperto is a charming and picturesque destination that offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape. Visitors can explore the historic architecture, wander through the quaint streets, and immerse themselves in the local culture. The area is known for its vibrant atmosphere and is a great place to relax and take in the beauty of the region. With its unique blend of old-world charm and modern amenities, L.
name: L.go Colle Aperto

detail_description: Battistero is located near the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore, making it convenient to visit both. Despite its unassuming exterior, this white marble cathedral surprises visitors with its grandeur once they step inside.
name: Battistero

detail_description: The Torre del Gombito, situated in the upper part of Bergamo, Italy, is a significant historical monument. This 12th-century tower offers breathtaking views of the city and its surroundings. The narrow steps lead to the top where visitors can admire the medieval architecture constructed from sandstone blocks. The area surrounding the tower is bustling with shops and bars housed in medieval buildings, adding to its charm.
name: Torre del Gombito
Teatro Sociale
address: Via Bartolomeo Colleoni, 4, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Bergamo, the Donizetti Museum is a tribute to the illustrious composer Gaetano Donizetti, who hails from this charming city. Located within the historic Palazzo della Misericordia Maggiore, this museum offers an immersive experience into Donizetti's life and works. As you step inside, you're welcomed by melodies from his most celebrated compositions.
name: Donizetti Museum

detail_description: Piazza Duomo, also known as Cathedral Square, is located adjacent to Piazza Vecchia and has a relatively compact feel compared to other Italian squares. The grandeur of the buildings surrounding the square contrasts with its limited space, creating a unique atmosphere. Despite feeling somewhat overshadowed by the more open and expansive Piazza Vecchia, Piazza Duomo boasts impressive architectural beauty.
name: Piazza Duomo

detail_description: Via Alla Rocca, also known as the Cittadella, is a historical fortification built by the wealthy rulers of Bergamo. It offers visitors a chance to explore its remains and learn about its rich history. Additionally, tourists can enjoy an exhilarating funicular ride from Bergamo Bassa to Bergamo Alta, providing stunning views of the surrounding area.
name: Via Alla Rocca

detail_description: Trattoria Casoncelli is a must-visit in Bergamo, known for its traditional dish, Casoncelli, which is a type of fresh pasta stuffed with meat and other ingredients. This unique dish is a staple of Bergamo cuisine and is often served with melted butter and sage. The trattoria offers exclusive tastings where visitors can indulge in the delicious Casoncelli as well as other typical dishes such as polenta.
name: Trattoria Casoncelli
address: Via S. Martino Vecchio, 2, 24020 Torre Boldone BG, Italy

excerpt: Large airport served mainly by budget lines with bus connections to various regional destinations.
detail_description: Il Caravaggio Orio al Serio International Airport is conveniently located less than 10 kilometers from the city center of Bergamo. Travelers can easily reach the upper town of Bergamo, known as Bergamo Citta Alta, by taking bus #1 from the airport, with a travel time of just 33 minutes.
name: Il Caravaggio International Airport
address: Via Aeroporto, 13, 24050 Orio al Serio BG, Italy

detail_description: Via San Tomaso is a charming and picturesque street in the heart of Bologna, Italy. Lined with historic buildings, cozy cafes, and artisan shops, it offers a delightful atmosphere for leisurely strolls and exploration. The street is known for its vibrant energy and authentic Italian vibe, making it a popular destination for both locals and tourists.
name: Via San Tomaso

detail_description: Bergamo Railway Station provides direct connections to Milan, Lecco, and Brescia, with additional links to Lake Garda, Verona, and Venice. It also offers bus services from Milan for convenient travel options.
name: Bergamo railway station

detail_description: Nestled in the historic Via Borgo Canale, you’ll find the birthplace of the renowned composer Gaetano Donizetti, a site steeped in cultural significance since it was declared a National Monument in 1926. This charming area reflects its rich past, showcasing how life once thrived among families living in modest homes while serving the aristocracy nearby.
name: Via Borgo Canale

detail_description: In Bergamo, Italy, the Festival of Lights A2A illuminates various locations including Via Porta Dipinta. This street is a must-see in Bergamo Alta due to its unique characteristic - the painted facades that make it stand out. While strolling along Via Porta Dipinta, visitors can also explore the Church of Sant'Andrea Apostolo and the Church of San Michele al Pozzo Bianco.
name: Via Porta Dipinta

detail_description: Via XX Settembre is a bustling street in Rome, lined with elegant buildings, trendy boutiques, and charming cafes. It's known for its vibrant atmosphere and is a popular spot for both locals and tourists to shop, dine, and soak up the city's energy. The street has a mix of modern shops and historic architecture, creating a unique blend of old-world charm and contemporary style.
name: Via XX Settembre

detail_description: Passaggio Nelle Mura Del Castello Di San Vigilio is an ancient structure strategically located on a hill overlooking Citta Alta of Bergamo. While the uphill climb can be challenging, there's a cable car available for a more convenient ascent, offering stunning panoramic views of the upper town. The castle provides a beautiful and less crowded viewpoint of the city, making it worth visiting even during peak tourist seasons.
name: Passaggio Nelle Mura Del Castello Di San Vigilio
address: Via al Castello, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: Antico Lavatoio, located in the Citta Alta, is a hidden gem where visitors and locals gather to wash clothes and socialize. This elegant structure, built in 1881, features a long tank of white marble covered by an iron and metal roof. It offers a water adduction system, overflow drain system, and gutter for water sprays during washing.
name: Antico Lavatoio
address: Via Mario Lupo, 6, 24129 Bergamo BG, Italy

excerpt: Tranquil green space featuring grassy picnic areas, exercise equipment, a pond & hiking paths.
detail_description: Trucca Park is the largest park in Bergamo Town and offers a serene green space with grassy picnic areas, exercise equipment, a pond, and hiking paths. It's an ideal spot for a peaceful day out where you can enjoy walking, running, or simply relaxing with a picnic. The park is well-maintained and features clean facilities including toilets. Visitors can also find areas for dogs to play and children to enjoy games.
name: Parco della Trucca
address: Via Martin Luther King, 100, 24127 Bergamo BG, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo del Podestà, located adjacent to Palazzo della Ragione and the Bishopric in Bergamo, was built in the late 12th century by the Suardi-Colleoni family. It served as the official residence of the Podesta, a foreign governor appointed for six months to govern the municipality. The palace overlooks Piazza Duomo and Piazza Vecchia, two main squares of medieval Bergamo.
name: Palazzo del Podestà - resti del Foro Romano e Museo del Cinquecento

excerpt: Bronze wall war memorial by Giacomo Manzù unveiled in 1977 dedicated to Italian resistance victims.
detail_description: The Monument to Partisans is a captivating bronze wall war memorial created by Giacomo Manzù and unveiled in 1977. It pays tribute to the victims of Italian resistance during World War II. This historical landmark, situated in the charming city of Bergamo, evokes a sense of admiration with its exquisite design and artistic expression. However, it is regrettable that without any translated boards or texts nearby, understanding the significance behind this monument becomes challenging for those who do not speak Italian.
name: Monument To Partisan
address: P.za Giacomo Matteotti, 24122 Bergamo BG, Italy
